definition: to capture/to restrain/to constrain/to adhere rigidly to/inflexible

sentences.english: I wish we could treat each other without formality.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望我们彼此之间不要太拘谨。

sentences.english: Tends to be shy or reserved in social situations. 060.
sentences.chinese: 在社交场合倾向于害羞或拘谨。

sentences.english: Nim and Ardythe had exchanged a few stilted words, but that was all.
sentences.chinese: 尼姆和阿黛丝拘谨地交谈了几句，没有别的。

sentences.english: Her face is bloated and squarish.
And her eyes on all my motions with a mute observance hung.
sentences.chinese: 她的双眸沉默而拘谨地牵挂着我的一举一动。

sentences.english: Virgin behavior is very formal, non-virgin more indulgent debauchery.
sentences.chinese: 处女举止行为都很拘谨，非处女放纵放荡些。

sentences.english: I imagine God to be rather formal, almost standoffish .
sentences.chinese: 在我想像中，神是拘谨的，近乎冷漠的。

sentences.english: Their mothers and grandmothers were perhaps a little more deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 她们的母亲和老祖母也许是过分拘谨了点儿。

sentences.english: The primness of Indian cinema is at odds with wider society.
sentences.chinese: 印度电影业的拘谨与整个社会环境并不相符。

sentences.english: Such postures convey a degree of formality and the degree of relaxation in the communication exchange.
sentences.chinese: 这样的一些姿势传递了在交流中拘谨或者放松的程度。

sentences.english: She gave a prudish refusal to enjoy rude jokes.
sentences.chinese: 她拘谨得听不得粗俗得笑话。

sentences.english: As he strode self-consciously on Alan focused his mind on her.
sentences.chinese: 当他拘谨地向前走的时候，他将注意力都在她的身上。

sentences.english: It was said that he was very formal, rigid, and hopelessly out of date.
sentences.chinese: 据说他拘谨刻板，完全落后于时代。

sentences.english: Sure, I hate those puritanical buggers back Home –I hate 'em with all my guts.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我恨国内那伙拘谨的家伙，我打心里恨他们。

sentences.english: Prudery is a demi-virtue and a demi-vice.
sentences.chinese: 腼腆拘谨也正是一种善恶参半的性格。

definition: affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
(of one's conduct, speech etc) natural and unrestrained
